name: junipermist
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Juniper Mist resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`mist` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Juniper/terraform-provider-mist).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Juniper Mist resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Juniper/terraform-provider-mist)
> distributed under [MIT](https://mit-license.org/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-junipermist` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-junipermist/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-mist` repo](https://github.com/Juniper/terraform-provider-mist/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/Juniper/terraform-provider-mist)
> distributed under [MIT](https://mit-license.org/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-junipermist` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-junipermist/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-mist` repo](https://github.com/Juniper/terraform-provider-mist/issues).

apiDebug.description: Flag to enable debugging API calls. Default is false.

apiTimeout.description: Timeout in seconds for completing API transactions with the Mist Cloud. Omit for default value of 10 seconds. Value of 0 results in infinite timeout.

apitoken.description: For API Token authentication, the Mist API Token.

host.description: URL of the Mist Cloud, e.g. `api.mist.com`.

password.description: For username/password authentication, the Mist Account password.

proxy.description: Requests use the configured proxy to reach the Mist Cloud. The value may be either a complete URL or a `[username:password@]host[:port]`, in which case the `http` scheme is assumed. The schemes `http`, `https`, and `socks5` are supported.

username.description: For username/password authentication, the Mist Account username.

enabled.description: Whether to enable aeroscout config

host.description: Required if enabled, aeroscout server host

locateConnected.description: Whether to enable the feature to allow wireless clients data received and sent to AES server for location calculation

enabled.description: Whether to enable Airista config

host.description: Required if enabled, Airista server host

beaconRate.description: Required if `beacon_rate_mode`==`custom`, 1-10, in number-beacons-per-second

beaconRateMode.description: enum: `custom`, `default`

beamDisableds.description: List of AP BLE location beam numbers (1-8) which should be disabled at the AP and not transmit location information (where beam 1 is oriented at the top the AP, growing counter-clock-wise, with 9 being the omni BLE beam)

customBlePacketEnabled.description: Can be enabled if `beacon_enabled`==`true`, whether to send custom packet

customBlePacketFrame.description: The custom frame to be sent out in this beacon. The frame must be a hexstring

customBlePacketFreqMsec.description: Frequency (msec) of data emitted by custom ble beacon

eddystoneUidAdvPower.description: Advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default

eddystoneUidEnabled.description: Only if `beacon_enabled`==`false`, Whether Eddystone-UID beacon is enabled

eddystoneUidFreqMsec.description: Frequency (msec) of data emit by Eddystone-UID beacon

eddystoneUrlAdvPower.description: Advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default

eddystoneUrlEnabled.description: Only if `beacon_enabled`==`false`, Whether Eddystone-URL beacon is enabled

eddystoneUrlFreqMsec.description: Frequency (msec) of data emit by Eddystone-UID beacon

ibeaconAdvPower.description: Advertised TX Power, -100 to 20 (dBm), omit this attribute to use default

ibeaconEnabled.description: Can be enabled if `beacon_enabled`==`true`, whether to send iBeacon

ibeaconFreqMsec.description: Frequency (msec) of data emit for iBeacon

ibeaconUuid.description: Optional, if not specified, the same UUID as the beacon will be used

power.description: Required if `power_mode`==`custom`; else use `power_mode` as default

powerMode.description: enum: `custom`, `default`

enabled.description:
When acted as client bridge:
  * only 5G radio can be used
  * will not serve as AP on any radios

type.description: wpa2-AES/CCMPp is assumed when `type`==`psk`. enum: `open`, `psk`

cacert.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag` or `type`==`native`

channel.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag` or `type`==`native`

enabled.description: usb_config is ignored if esl_config enabled

host.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag` or `type`==`native`

port.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag` or `type`==`native`

type.description: note: ble_config will be ignored if esl_config is enabled and with native mode. enum: `hanshow`, `imagotag`, `native`, `solum`

verifyCert.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag` or `type`==`native`

vlanId.description: Only if `type`==`solum` or `type`==`hanshow`

dns.description: If `type`==`static`

dnsSuffixes.description: Required if `type`==`static`

gateway.description: Required if `type`==`static`

ip.description: Required if `type`==`static`

netmask.description: Required if `type`==`static`

type.description: enum: `dhcp`, `static`

type6.description: enum: `autoconf`, `dhcp`, `disabled`, `static`

bands.description: List of bands that the mesh should apply to. For relay, the first viable one will be picked. For relay, the first viable one will be picked. enum: `24`, `5`, `6`

enabled.description: Whether mesh is enabled on this AP

group.description: Mesh group, base AP(s) will only allow remote AP(s) in the same mesh group to join, 1-9, optional

role.description: enum: `base`, `remote`

forwarding.description: enum: * `all`: local breakout, All VLANs * `limited`: local breakout, only the VLANs configured in `port_vlan_id` and `vlan_ids` * `mxtunnel`: central breakout to an Org Mist Edge (requires `mxtunnel_id`) * `site_mxedge`: central breakout to a Site Mist Edge (requires `mxtunnel_name`) * `wxtunnel`': central breakout to an Org WxTunnel (requires `wxtunnel_id`)

macAuthPreferred.description: When `true`, we'll do dot1x then mac_auth. enable this to prefer mac_auth

macAuthProtocol.description: if `enable_mac_auth`==`true`, allows user to select an authentication protocol. enum: `eap-md5`, `eap-peap`, `pap`

mxTunnelId.description: If `forwarding`==`mxtunnel`, vlan_ids comes from mxtunnel

mxtunnelName.description: If `forwarding`==`site_mxedge`, vlan_ids comes from site_mxedge (`mxtunnels` under site setting)

portAuth.description: When doing port auth. enum: `dot1x`, `none`

portVlanId.description: If `forwarding`==`limited`

vlanId.description: Optional to specify the vlan id for a tunnel if forwarding is for `wxtunnel`, `mxtunnel` or `site_mxedge`. * if vlan_id is not specified then it will use first one in vlan_ids[] of the mxtunnel. * if forwarding == site_mxedge, vlan_ids comes from site_mxedge (`mxtunnels` under site setting)

vlanIds.description: If `forwarding`==`limited`

wxtunnelId.description: If `forwarding`==`wxtunnel`, the port is bridged to the vlan of the session

wxtunnelRemoteId.description: If `forwarding`==`wxtunnel`, the port is bridged to the vlan of the session

acctInterimInterval.description: How frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled.

authServersRetries.description: Radius auth session retries. Following fast timers are set if `fast_dot1x_timers` knob is enabled. "retries" are set to value of `auth_servers_timeout`. "max-requests" is also set when setting `auth_servers_retries` is set to default value to 3.

authServersTimeout.description: Radius auth session timeout. Following fast timers are set if `fast_dot1x_timers` knob is enabled. "quite-period" and "transmit-period" are set to half the value of `auth_servers_timeout`. "supplicant-timeout" is also set when setting `auth_servers_timeout` is set to default value of 10.

coaEnabled.description: Allows a RADIUS server to dynamically modify the authorization status of a user session.

coaPort.description: the communication port used for Change of Authorization (CoA) messages

enabled.description: When enabled: * `auth_servers` is ignored * `acct_servers` is ignored * `auth_servers_*` are ignored * `coa_servers` is ignored * `radsec` is ignored * `coa_enabled` is assumed

fastDot1xTimers.description: If set to true, sets default fast-timers with values calculated from `auth_servers_timeout` and `auth_server_retries`.

network.description: Which network the mist nac server resides in

sourceIp.description: In case there is a static IP for this network, we can specify it using source ip

acctInterimInterval.description: How frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from RADIUS Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled

network.description: use `network`or `source_ip`, which network the RADIUS server resides, if there's static IP for this network, we'd use it as source-ip

sourceIp.description: use `network`or `source_ip`

keywrapFormat.description: enum: `ascii`, `hex`
enum: `ascii`, `hex`

requireMessageAuthenticator.description: Whether to require Message-Authenticator in requests

mxclusterIds.description: To use Org mxedges when this WLAN does not use mxtunnel, specify their mxcluster_ids. Org mxedge(s) identified by mxcluster_ids

proxyHosts.description: Default is site.mxedge.radsec.proxy_hosts which must be a superset of all `wlans[*].radsec.proxy_hosts`. When `radsec.proxy_hosts` are not used, tunnel peers (org or site mxedges) are used irrespective of `use_site_mxedge`

serverName.description: Name of the server to verify (against the cacerts in Org Setting). Only if not Mist Edge.

servers.description: List of RadSec Servers. Only if not Mist Edge.

useSiteMxedge.description: To use Site mxedges when this WLAN does not use mxtunnel

base.description: Additional power to request during negotiating with PSE over PoE, in mW

preferUsbOverWifi.description: Whether to enable power out to peripheral, meanwhile will reduce power to Wi-Fi (only for AP45 at power mode)

antGain24.description: Antenna gain for 2.4G - for models with external antenna only

antGain5.description: Antenna gain for 5G - for models with external antenna only

antGain6.description: Antenna gain for 6G - for models with external antenna only

antennaMode.description: enum: `1x1`, `2x2`, `3x3`, `4x4`, `default`

band24Usage.description: enum: `24`, `5`, `6`, `auto`

fullAutomaticRrm.description: Let RRM control everything, only the `channels` and `ant_gain` will be honored (i.e. disabled/bandwidth/power/band_24_usage are all controlled by RRM)

indoorUse.description: To make an outdoor operate indoor. For an outdoor-ap, some channels are disallowed by default, this allows the user to use it as an indoor-ap

antennaMode.description: enum: `1x1`, `2x2`, `3x3`, `4x4`, `default`

bandwidth.description: channel width for the 2.4GHz band. enum: `20`, `40`

channel.description: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting

channels.description: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto

power.description: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 means auto. -1 / -2 / -3 / : treated as 0 / -1 / -2 /

powerMax.description: When power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

powerMin.description: When power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

preamble.description: enum: `auto`, `long`, `short`

antennaMode.description: enum: `1x1`, `2x2`, `3x3`, `4x4`, `default`

bandwidth.description: channel width for the 5GHz band. enum: `20`, `40`, `80`

channel.description: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting

channels.description: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto

power.description: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 means auto. -1 / -2 / -3 / : treated as 0 / -1 / -2 /

powerMax.description: When power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

powerMin.description: When power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

bandwidth.description: channel width for the 5GHz band. enum: `20`, `40`, `80`

channel.description: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting

channels.description: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto

power.description: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 means auto. -1 / -2 / -3 / : treated as 0 / -1 / -2 /

powerMax.description: When power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

powerMin.description: When power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

preamble.description: enum: `auto`, `long`, `short`

antennaMode.description: enum: `1x1`, `2x2`, `3x3`, `4x4`, `default`

bandwidth.description: channel width for the 6GHz band. enum: `20`, `40`, `80`, `160`

channel.description: For Device. (primary) channel for the band, 0 means using the Site Setting

channels.description: For RFTemplates. List of channels, null or empty array means auto

power.description: TX power of the radio. For Devices, 0 means auto. -1 / -2 / -3 / : treated as 0 / -1 / -2 /

powerMax.description: When power=0, max tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

powerMin.description: When power=0, min tx power to use, HW-specific values will be used if not set

preamble.description: enum: `auto`, `long`, `short`

standardPower.description: For 6GHz Only, standard-power operation, AFC (Automatic Frequency Coordination) will be performed, and we'll fall back to Low Power Indoor if AFC failed

dot1x.description: Whether to do 802.1x against uplink switch. When enabled, AP cert will be used to do EAP-TLS and the Org's CA Cert has to be provisioned at the switch

keepWlansUpIfDown.description: By default, WLANs are disabled when uplink is down. In some scenario, like SiteSurvey, one would want the AP to keep sending beacons.

cacert.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`

channel.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`, channel selection, not needed by default, required for manual channel override only

enabled.description: Whether to enable any usb config

host.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`

port.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`

type.description: usb config type. enum: `hanshow`, `imagotag`, `solum`

verifyCert.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`, whether to turn on SSL verification

vlanId.description: Only if `type`==`solum` or `type`==`hanshow`

authKey.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`

bfdMinimumInterval.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`, when bfd_multiplier is configured alone. Default: * 1000 if `type`==`external` * 350 `type`==`internal`

bfdMultiplier.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`, when bfd_minimum_interval_is_configured alone

disableBfd.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. BFD provides faster path failure detection and is enabled by default

exportPolicy.description: Default export policies if no per-neighbor policies defined

extendedV4Nexthop.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. By default, either inet/net6 unicast depending on neighbor IP family (v4 or v6). For v6 neighbors, to exchange v4 nexthop, which allows dual-stack support, enable this

gracefulRestartTime.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. `0` means disable

holdTime.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. Default is 90.

importPolicy.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. Default import policies if no per-neighbor policies defined

localAs.description: Required if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. BGPLocal AS. Value must be in range 1-4294967295 or a variable (e.g. `{{as_variable}}`)

neighborAs.description: Neighbor AS. If `type`==`internal`, must be equal to `local_as`. Value must be in range 1-4294967295 or a variable (e.g. `{{as_variable}}`)

neighbors.description: Required if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. If per-neighbor as is desired. Property key is the neighbor address

networks.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`. List of networks where we expect BGP neighbor to connect to/from

noPrivateAs.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. If true, we will not advertise private ASNs (AS 64512-65534) to this neighbor

noReadvertiseToOverlay.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. By default, we'll re-advertise all learned BGP routers toward overlay

tunnelName.description: Optional if `via`==`tunnel`

type.description: Required if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. enum: `external`, `internal`

via.description: enum: `lan`, `tunnel`, `vpn`, `wan`

vpnName.description: Optional if `via`==`vpn`

wanName.description: Optional if `via`==`wan`

disabled.description: If true, the BGP session to this neighbor will be administratively disabled/shutdown

multihopTtl.description: Assuming BGP neighbor is directly connected

neighborAs.description: Neighbor AS. Value must be in range 1-4294967295 or a variable (e.g. `{{as_variable}}`)

mac.description: Gateway MAC Address. Format is `[0-9a-f]{12}` (e.g. "5684dae9ac8b")

config.description: Property key is the network name

enabled.description: If set to `false`, disable the DHCP server

dnsServers.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local` - optional, if not defined, system one will be used

dnsSuffixes.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local` - optional, if not defined, system one will be used
dnsSuffixes.deprecationMessage: Configuring `dns_suffix` is deprecated and will not be supported in the future, please configure Code 15 or Code 119 in Server `options` instead

fixedBindings.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is the MAC Address. Format is `[0-9a-f]{12}` (e.g. "5684dae9ac8b")

gateway.description: If `type`==`local` - optional, `ip` will be used if not provided

ip6End.description: If `type6`==`local`

ip6Start.description: If `type6`==`local`

ipEnd.description: If `type`==`local`

ipStart.description: If `type`==`local`

leaseTime.description: In seconds, lease time has to be between 3600 [1hr] - 604800 [1 week], default is 86400 [1 day]

options.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is the DHCP option number

serverIdOverride.description: `server_id_override`==`true` means the device, when acts as DHCP relay and forwards DHCP responses from DHCP server to clients, should overwrite the Sever Identifier option (i.e. DHCP option 54) in DHCP responses with its own IP address.

servers.description: If `type`==`relay`

serversv6s.description: If `type6`==`relay`

type.description: enum: `local` (DHCP Server), `none`, `relay` (DHCP Relay)

type6.description: enum: `local` (DHCP Server), `none`, `relay` (DHCP Relay)

vendorEncapsulated.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is :, with * enterprise number: 1-65535 (https://www.iana.org/assignments/enterprise-numbers/enterprise-numbers) * sub option code: 1-255, sub-option code

type.description: enum: `boolean`, `hex`, `int16`, `int32`, `ip`, `string`, `uint16`, `uint32`
enum: `boolean`, `hex`, `int16`, `int32`, `ip`, `string`, `uint16`, `uint32`

baseProfile.description: enum: `critical`, `standard`, `strict`

id.description: Unique ID of the object instance in the Mist Organization

action.description:
enum:
  * alert (default)
  * drop: silently dropping packets
  * close: notify client/server to close connection

secondaryIps.description: Optional list of secondary IPs in CIDR format

type.description: enum: `dhcp`, `static`

type6.description: enum: `autoconf`, `dhcp`, `disabled`, `static`

disallowMistServices.description: Whether to disallow Mist Devices in the network

internetAccess.description: Whether this network has direct internet access

isolation.description: Whether to allow clients in the network to talk to each other

multicast.description: Whether to enable multicast support (only PIM-sparse mode is supported)

routedForNetworks.description: For a Network (usually LAN), it can be routable to other networks (e.g. OSPF)

tenants.description: Property key must be the user/tenant name (i.e. "printer-1") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

vpnAccess.description: Property key is the VPN name. Whether this network can be accessed from vpn

destinationNat.description: Property key can be an External IP (i.e. "63.16.0.3"), an External IP:Port (i.e. "63.16.0.3:443"), an External Port (i.e. ":443"), an External CIDR (i.e. "63.16.0.0/30"), an External CIDR:Port (i.e. "63.16.0.0/30:443") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}"). At least one of the `internal_ip` or `port` must be defined

restricted.description: By default, all access is allowed, to only allow certain traffic, make `restricted`=`true` and define service_policies

staticNat.description: Property key may be an External IP Address (i.e. "63.16.0.3"), a CIDR (i.e. "63.16.0.12/20") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

internalIp.description: The Destination NAT destination IP Address. Must be an IP (i.e. "192.168.70.30") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

port.description: The Destination NAT destination IP Address. Must be a Port (i.e. "443") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

wanName.description: SRX Only. If not set, we configure the nat policies against all WAN ports for simplicity

internalIp.description: The Static NAT destination IP Address. Must be an IP Address (i.e. "192.168.70.3") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

wanName.description: SRX Only. If not set, we configure the nat policies against all WAN ports for simplicity. Can be a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

disableIgmp.description: If the network will only be the source of the multicast traffic, IGMP can be disabled

groups.description: Group address to RP (rendezvous point) mapping. Property Key is the CIDR (example "225.1.0.3/32")

advertisedSubnet.description: If `routed`==`true`, whether to advertise an aggregated subnet toward HUB this is useful when there are multiple networks on SPOKE's side

allowPing.description: Whether to allow ping from vpn into this routed network

destinationNat.description: Property key can be an External IP (i.e. "63.16.0.3"), an External IP:Port (i.e. "63.16.0.3:443"), an External Port (i.e. ":443"), an External CIDR (i.e. "63.16.0.0/30"), an External CIDR:Port (i.e. "63.16.0.0/30:443") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}"). At least one of the `internal_ip` or `port` must be defined

natPool.description: If `routed`==`false` (usually at Spoke), but some hosts needs to be reachable from Hub, a subnet is required to create and advertise the route to Hub

noReadvertiseToOverlay.description: toward overlay, how HUB should deal with routes it received from Spokes

otherVrfs.description: By default, the routes are only readvertised toward the same vrf on spoke. To allow it to be leaked to other vrfs

sourceNat.description: If `routed`==`false` (usually at Spoke), but some hosts needs to be reachable from Hub

staticNat.description: Property key may be an External IP Address (i.e. "63.16.0.3"), a CIDR (i.e. "63.16.0.12/20") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

summarizedSubnet.description: toward overlay, how HUB should deal with routes it received from Spokes

internalIp.description: The Destination NAT destination IP Address. Must be an IP (i.e. "192.168.70.30") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")
The Static NAT destination IP Address. Must be an IP Address (i.e. "192.168.70.3") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

gateway.description: If `type`==`static`

ip.description: If `type`==`static`

netmask.description: If `type`==`static`

node1.description: For HA Cluster, node1 can have different IP Config

type.description: enum: `dhcp`, `static`

useMgmtVrf.description: If supported on the platform. If enabled, DNS will be using this routing-instance, too

useMgmtVrfForHostOut.description: For host-out traffic (NTP/TACPLUS/RADIUS/SYSLOG/SNMP), if alternative source network/ip is desired

gateway.description: If `type`==`static`

netmask.description: Used only if `subnet` is not specified in `networks`

type.description: enum: `dhcp`, `static`

useMgmtVrf.description: If supported on the platform. If enabled, DNS will be using this routing-instance, too

useMgmtVrfForHostOut.description: Whether to use `mgmt_junos` for host-out traffic (NTP/TACPLUS/RADIUS/SYSLOG/SNMP), if alternative source network/ip is desired

strategy.description: enum: `ecmp`, `ordered`, `weighted`

disabled.description: For SSR Only. `true`, if this specific path is undesired

gatewayIp.description: Only if `type`==`local`, if a different gateway is desired

internetAccess.description: Only if `type`==`vpn`, if this vpn path can be used for internet

name.description: Required when * `type`==`vpn`: the name of the VPN Path to use * `type`==`wan`: the name of the WAN interface to use

networks.description: Required when `type`==`local`

targetIps.description: If `type`==`local`, if destination IP is to be replaced

type.description: enum: `local`, `tunnel`, `vpn`, `wan`

wanName.description: Optional if `type`==`vpn`

aeDisableLacp.description: If `aggregated`==`true`. To disable LCP support for the AE interface

aeIdx.description: If `aggregated`==`true`. Users could force to use the designated AE name (must be an integer between 0 and 127)

aeLacpForceUp.description: For SRX Only, if `aggregated`==`true`.Sets the state of the interface as UP when the peer has limited LACP capability. Use case: When a device connected to this AE port is ZTPing for the first time, it will not have LACP configured on the other end. **Note:** Turning this on will enable force-up on one of the interfaces in the bundle only

critical.description: To generate port up/down alarm, set it to true

description.description: Interface Description. Can be a variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

dslType.description: if `wan_type`==`dsl`. enum: `adsl`, `vdsl`

outputNetwork.description: Exactly one of the `output_ip_address`, `output_port_id` or `output_network` should be provided

outputPortId.description: Exactly one of the `output_ip_address`, `output_port_id` or `output_network` should be provided

allNetworks.description: Only if `mode`==`trunk` whether to trunk all network/vlans

allowDhcpd.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`. If DHCP snooping is enabled, whether DHCP server is allowed on the interfaces with. All the interfaces from port configs using this port usage are effected. Please notice that allow_dhcpd is a tri_state. When it is not defined, it means using the system's default setting which depends on whether the port is an access or trunk port.

allowMultipleSupplicants.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

bypassAuthWhenServerDown.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` bypass auth for known clients if set to true when RADIUS server is down

bypassAuthWhenServerDownForUnknownClient.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`=`dot1x` bypass auth for all (including unknown clients) if set to true when RADIUS server is down

communityVlanId.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`. To be used together with `isolation` under networks. Signaling that this port connects to the networks isolated but wired clients belong to the same community can talk to each other

description.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

disableAutoneg.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` if speed and duplex are specified, whether to disable autonegotiation

disabled.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` whether the port is disabled

duplex.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`, link connection mode. enum: `auto`, `full`, `half`

dynamicVlanNetworks.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x`, if dynamic vlan is used, specify the possible networks/vlans RADIUS can return

enableMacAuth.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` whether to enable MAC Auth

enableQos.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

guestNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` which network to put the device into if the device cannot do dot1x. default is null (i.e. not allowed)

interIsolationNetworkLink.description: `inter_switch_link` is used together with `isolation` under networks. NOTE: `inter_switch_link` works only between Juniper device. This has to be applied to both ports connected together

interSwitchLink.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` inter_switch_link is used together with "isolation" under networks. NOTE: inter_switch_link works only between Juniper device. This has to be applied to both ports connected together

macAuthOnly.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `enable_mac_auth`==`true`

macAuthPreferred.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` + `enable_mac_auth`==`true` + `mac_auth_only`==`false`, dot1x will be given priority then mac_auth. Enable this to prefer mac_auth over dot1x.

macAuthProtocol.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `enable_mac_auth` ==`true`. This type is ignored if mist_nac is enabled. enum: `eap-md5`, `eap-peap`, `pap`

macLimit.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` max number of mac addresses, default is 0 for unlimited, otherwise range is 1 to 16383 (upper bound constrained by platform)

mode.description: `mode`==`dynamic` must only be used if the port usage name is `dynamic`. enum: `access`, `dynamic`, `inet`, `trunk`

mtu.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` media maximum transmission unit (MTU) is the largest data unit that can be forwarded without fragmentation. Value between 256 and 9216, default value is 1514.

networks.description: Only if `mode`==`trunk`, the list of network/vlans

persistMac.description: Only if `mode`==`access` and `port_auth`!=`dot1x` whether the port should retain dynamically learned MAC addresses

poeDisabled.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` whether PoE capabilities are disabled for a port

portAuth.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` if dot1x is desired, set to dot1x. enum: `dot1x`

portNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` native network/vlan for untagged traffic

reauthInterval.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`=`dot1x` reauthentication interval range between 10 and 65535 (default: 3600)

resetDefaultWhen.description: Only if `mode`==`dynamic` Control when the DPC port should be changed to the default port usage. enum: `link_down`, `none` (let the DPC port keep at the current port usage)

rules.description: Only if `mode`==`dynamic`

serverFailNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` sets server fail fallback vlan

serverRejectNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` when radius server reject / fails

speed.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`, Port speed, default is auto to automatically negotiate speed enum: `100m`, `10m`, `1g`, `2.5g`, `5g`, `10g`, `25g`, `40g`, `100g`,`auto`

stormControl.description: Switch storm control. Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

stpEdge.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` when enabled, the port is not expected to receive BPDU frames

useVstp.description: If this is connected to a vstp network

voipNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` network/vlan for voip traffic, must also set port_network. to authenticate device, set port_auth

equalsAnies.description: Use `equals_any` to match any item in a list

src.description: enum: `link_peermac`, `lldp_chassis_id`, `lldp_hardware_revision`, `lldp_manufacturer_name`, `lldp_oui`, `lldp_serial_number`, `lldp_system_name`, `radius_dynamicfilter`, `radius_usermac`, `radius_username`

usage.description: `port_usage` name

disablePort.description: Whether to disable the port when storm control is triggered

noBroadcast.description: Whether to disable storm control on broadcast traffic

noMulticast.description: Whether to disable storm control on multicast traffic

noRegisteredMulticast.description: Whether to disable storm control on registered multicast traffic

noUnknownUnicast.description: Whether to disable storm control on unknown unicast traffic

percentage.description: Bandwidth-percentage, configures the storm control level as a percentage of the available bandwidth

acctInterimInterval.description: How frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from RADIUS Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled

authServerSelection.description: enum: `ordered`, `unordered`

network.description: Use `network`or `source_ip`. Which network the RADIUS server resides, if there's static IP for this network, we'd use it as source-ip

Restrict inbound-traffic to host

bands.description: List of bands that the mesh should apply to. For relay, the first viable one will be picked. For relay, the first viable one will be picked. enum: `24`, `5`, `6`

group.description: Mesh group, base AP(s) will only allow remote AP(s) in the same mesh group to join, 1-9, optional

role.description: enum: `base`, `remote`

forwarding.description: enum: * `all`: local breakout, All VLANs * `limited`: local breakout, only the VLANs configured in `port_vlan_id` and `vlan_ids` * `mxtunnel`: central breakout to an Org Mist Edge (requires `mxtunnel_id`) * `site_mxedge`: central breakout to a Site Mist Edge (requires `mxtunnel_name`) * `wxtunnel`': central breakout to an Org WxTunnel (requires `wxtunnel_id`)

macAuthPreferred.description: When `true`, we'll do dot1x then mac_auth. enable this to prefer mac_auth

macAuthProtocol.description: if `enable_mac_auth`==`true`, allows user to select an authentication protocol. enum: `eap-md5`, `eap-peap`, `pap`

mxTunnelId.description: If `forwarding`==`mxtunnel`, vlan_ids comes from mxtunnel

mxtunnelName.description: If `forwarding`==`site_mxedge`, vlan_ids comes from site_mxedge (`mxtunnels` under site setting)

portAuth.description: When doing port auth. enum: `dot1x`, `none`

portVlanId.description: If `forwarding`==`limited`

vlanId.description: Optional to specify the vlan id for a tunnel if forwarding is for `wxtunnel`, `mxtunnel` or `site_mxedge`. * if vlan_id is not specified then it will use first one in vlan_ids[] of the mxtunnel. * if forwarding == site_mxedge, vlan_ids comes from site_mxedge (`mxtunnels` under site setting)

vlanIds.description: If `forwarding`==`limited`

wxtunnelId.description: If `forwarding`==`wxtunnel`, the port is bridged to the vlan of the session

wxtunnelRemoteId.description: If `forwarding`==`wxtunnel`, the port is bridged to the vlan of the session

acctInterimInterval.description: How frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled.

authServersRetries.description: Radius auth session retries. Following fast timers are set if `fast_dot1x_timers` knob is enabled. "retries" are set to value of `auth_servers_timeout`. "max-requests" is also set when setting `auth_servers_retries` is set to default value to 3.

authServersTimeout.description: Radius auth session timeout. Following fast timers are set if `fast_dot1x_timers` knob is enabled. "quite-period" and "transmit-period" are set to half the value of `auth_servers_timeout`. "supplicant-timeout" is also set when setting `auth_servers_timeout` is set to default value of 10.

coaEnabled.description: Allows a RADIUS server to dynamically modify the authorization status of a user session.

coaPort.description: the communication port used for Change of Authorization (CoA) messages

enabled.description: When enabled: * `auth_servers` is ignored * `acct_servers` is ignored * `auth_servers_*` are ignored * `coa_servers` is ignored * `radsec` is ignored * `coa_enabled` is assumed

fastDot1xTimers.description: If set to true, sets default fast-timers with values calculated from `auth_servers_timeout` and `auth_server_retries`.

network.description: Which network the mist nac server resides in

sourceIp.description: In case there is a static IP for this network, we can specify it using source ip

standardPower.description: For 6GHz Only, standard-power operation, AFC (Automatic Frequency Coordination) will be performed, and we'll fall back to Low Power Indoor if AFC failed

dot1x.description: Whether to do 802.1x against uplink switch. When enabled, AP cert will be used to do EAP-TLS and the Org's CA Cert has to be provisioned at the switch

keepWlansUpIfDown.description: By default, WLANs are disabled when uplink is down. In some scenario, like SiteSurvey, one would want the AP to keep sending beacons.

cacert.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`

channel.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`, channel selection, not needed by default, required for manual channel override only

enabled.description: Whether to enable any usb config

host.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`

port.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`

type.description: usb config type. enum: `hanshow`, `imagotag`, `solum`

verifyCert.description: Only if `type`==`imagotag`, whether to turn on SSL verification

vlanId.description: Only if `type`==`solum` or `type`==`hanshow`

authKey.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`

bfdMinimumInterval.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`, when bfd_multiplier is configured alone. Default: * 1000 if `type`==`external` * 350 `type`==`internal`

bfdMultiplier.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`, when bfd_minimum_interval_is_configured alone

disableBfd.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. BFD provides faster path failure detection and is enabled by default

exportPolicy.description: Default export policies if no per-neighbor policies defined

extendedV4Nexthop.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. By default, either inet/net6 unicast depending on neighbor IP family (v4 or v6). For v6 neighbors, to exchange v4 nexthop, which allows dual-stack support, enable this

gracefulRestartTime.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. `0` means disable

holdTime.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. Default is 90.

importPolicy.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. Default import policies if no per-neighbor policies defined

localAs.description: Required if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. BGPLocal AS. Value must be in range 1-4294967295 or a variable (e.g. `{{as_variable}}`)

neighborAs.description: Neighbor AS. If `type`==`internal`, must be equal to `local_as`. Value must be in range 1-4294967295 or a variable (e.g. `{{as_variable}}`)

neighbors.description: Required if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. If per-neighbor as is desired. Property key is the neighbor address

networks.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`. List of networks where we expect BGP neighbor to connect to/from

noPrivateAs.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. If true, we will not advertise private ASNs (AS 64512-65534) to this neighbor

noReadvertiseToOverlay.description: Optional if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. By default, we'll re-advertise all learned BGP routers toward overlay

tunnelName.description: Optional if `via`==`tunnel`

type.description: Required if `via`==`lan`, `via`==`tunnel` or `via`==`wan`. enum: `external`, `internal`

via.description: enum: `lan`, `tunnel`, `vpn`, `wan`

vpnName.description: Optional if `via`==`vpn`

wanName.description: Optional if `via`==`wan`

disabled.description: If true, the BGP session to this neighbor will be administratively disabled/shutdown

multihopTtl.description: Assuming BGP neighbor is directly connected

neighborAs.description: Neighbor AS. Value must be in range 1-4294967295 or a variable (e.g. `{{as_variable}}`)

config.description: Property key is the network name

enabled.description: If set to `false`, disable the DHCP server

dnsServers.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local` - optional, if not defined, system one will be used

dnsSuffixes.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local` - optional, if not defined, system one will be used
dnsSuffixes.deprecationMessage: Configuring `dns_suffix` is deprecated and will not be supported in the future, please configure Code 15 or Code 119 in Server `options` instead

fixedBindings.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is the MAC Address. Format is `[0-9a-f]{12}` (e.g. "5684dae9ac8b")

gateway.description: If `type`==`local` - optional, `ip` will be used if not provided

ip6End.description: If `type6`==`local`

ip6Start.description: If `type6`==`local`

ipEnd.description: If `type`==`local`

ipStart.description: If `type`==`local`

leaseTime.description: In seconds, lease time has to be between 3600 [1hr] - 604800 [1 week], default is 86400 [1 day]

options.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is the DHCP option number

serverIdOverride.description: `server_id_override`==`true` means the device, when acts as DHCP relay and forwards DHCP responses from DHCP server to clients, should overwrite the Sever Identifier option (i.e. DHCP option 54) in DHCP responses with its own IP address.

servers.description: If `type`==`relay`

serversv6s.description: If `type6`==`relay`

type.description: enum: `local` (DHCP Server), `none`, `relay` (DHCP Relay)

type6.description: enum: `local` (DHCP Server), `none`, `relay` (DHCP Relay)

vendorEncapsulated.description: If `type`==`local` or `type6`==`local`. Property key is :, with * enterprise number: 1-65535 (https://www.iana.org/assignments/enterprise-numbers/enterprise-numbers) * sub option code: 1-255, sub-option code

type.description: enum: `boolean`, `hex`, `int16`, `int32`, `ip`, `string`, `uint16`, `uint32`
enum: `boolean`, `hex`, `int16`, `int32`, `ip`, `string`, `uint16`, `uint32`

baseProfile.description: enum: `critical`, `standard`, `strict`

action.description:
enum:
  * alert (default)
  * drop: silently dropping packets
  * close: notify client/server to close connection

secondaryIps.description: Optional list of secondary IPs in CIDR format

type.description: enum: `dhcp`, `static`

type6.description: enum: `autoconf`, `dhcp`, `disabled`, `static`

disallowMistServices.description: Whether to disallow Mist Devices in the network

internetAccess.description: Whether this network has direct internet access

isolation.description: Whether to allow clients in the network to talk to each other

multicast.description: Whether to enable multicast support (only PIM-sparse mode is supported)

routedForNetworks.description: For a Network (usually LAN), it can be routable to other networks (e.g. OSPF)

tenants.description: Property key must be the user/tenant name (i.e. "printer-1") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

vpnAccess.description: Property key is the VPN name. Whether this network can be accessed from vpn

destinationNat.description: Property key can be an External IP (i.e. "63.16.0.3"), an External IP:Port (i.e. "63.16.0.3:443"), an External Port (i.e. ":443"), an External CIDR (i.e. "63.16.0.0/30"), an External CIDR:Port (i.e. "63.16.0.0/30:443") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}"). At least one of the `internal_ip` or `port` must be defined

restricted.description: By default, all access is allowed, to only allow certain traffic, make `restricted`=`true` and define service_policies

staticNat.description: Property key may be an External IP Address (i.e. "63.16.0.3"), a CIDR (i.e. "63.16.0.12/20") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

internalIp.description: The Destination NAT destination IP Address. Must be an IP (i.e. "192.168.70.30") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

port.description: The Destination NAT destination IP Address. Must be a Port (i.e. "443") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

wanName.description: SRX Only. If not set, we configure the nat policies against all WAN ports for simplicity

internalIp.description: The Static NAT destination IP Address. Must be an IP Address (i.e. "192.168.70.3") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

wanName.description: SRX Only. If not set, we configure the nat policies against all WAN ports for simplicity. Can be a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

disableIgmp.description: If the network will only be the source of the multicast traffic, IGMP can be disabled

groups.description: Group address to RP (rendezvous point) mapping. Property Key is the CIDR (example "225.1.0.3/32")

advertisedSubnet.description: If `routed`==`true`, whether to advertise an aggregated subnet toward HUB this is useful when there are multiple networks on SPOKE's side

allowPing.description: Whether to allow ping from vpn into this routed network

destinationNat.description: Property key can be an External IP (i.e. "63.16.0.3"), an External IP:Port (i.e. "63.16.0.3:443"), an External Port (i.e. ":443"), an External CIDR (i.e. "63.16.0.0/30"), an External CIDR:Port (i.e. "63.16.0.0/30:443") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}"). At least one of the `internal_ip` or `port` must be defined

natPool.description: If `routed`==`false` (usually at Spoke), but some hosts needs to be reachable from Hub, a subnet is required to create and advertise the route to Hub

noReadvertiseToOverlay.description: toward overlay, how HUB should deal with routes it received from Spokes

otherVrfs.description: By default, the routes are only readvertised toward the same vrf on spoke. To allow it to be leaked to other vrfs

sourceNat.description: If `routed`==`false` (usually at Spoke), but some hosts needs to be reachable from Hub

perVlanVgaV6Mac.description: Only for by Core-Distribution architecture when `evpn_options.routed_at`==`core`. By default, JUNOS uses 00-00-5e-00-02-01 as the virtual-gateway-address's v6_mac. If enabled, 00-00-5e-00-1X-YY will be used (where XX=vlan_id/256, YY=vlan_id%256)

  * for CLOS, to group dist / access switches into pods
  * for ERB/CRB, to group dist / esilag-access into pods

pods.description:
By default, core switches are assumed to be connecting all pods. 
if you want to limit the pods, you can specify pods.

allowPing.description: Whether to allow ping from vpn into this routed network

noReadvertiseToOverlay.description: toward overlay, how HUB should deal with routes it received from Spokes

otherVrfs.description: By default, the routes are only readvertised toward the same vrf on spoke. To allow it to be leaked to other vrfs

sourceNat.description: If `routed`==`false` (usually at Spoke), but some hosts needs to be reachable from Hub

staticNat.description: Property key may be an External IP Address (i.e. "63.16.0.3"), a CIDR (i.e. "63.16.0.12/20") or a Variable (i.e. "{{myvar}}")

summarizedSubnet.description: toward overlay, how HUB should deal with routes it received from Spokes

actions.description: ACL Policy Actions: - for GBP-based policy, all src_tags and dst_tags have to be gbp-based - for ACL-based policy, `network` is required in either the source or destination so that we know where to attach the policy to

srcTags.description: ACL Policy Source Tags: - for GBP-based policy, all src_tags and dst_tags have to be gbp-based - for ACL-based policy, `network` is required in either the source or destination so that we know where to attach the policy to

action.description: enum: `allow`, `deny`

etherTypes.description: Can only be used under dst tags.

gbpTag.description: Required if - `type`==`dynamic_gbp` (gbp_tag received from RADIUS) - `type`==`gbp_resource` - `type`==`static_gbp` (applying gbp tag against matching conditions)

macs.description: Required if - `type`==`mac` - `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching mac

network.description: If: * `type`==`mac` (optional. default is `any`) * `type`==`subnet` (optional. default is `any`) * `type`==`network` * `type`==`resource` (optional. default is `any`) * `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching network (vlan)

portUsage.description: Required if `type`==`port_usage`

radiusGroup.description: Required if: * `type`==`radius_group` * `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching radius_group

specs.description: If `type`==`resource`, `type`==`radius_group`, `type`==`port_usage` or `type`==`gbp_resource`. Empty means unrestricted, i.e. any

subnets.description: If - `type`==`subnet` - `type`==`resource` (optional. default is `any`) - `type`==`static_gbp` if from matching subnet

type.description: enum: * `any`: matching anything not identified * `dynamic_gbp`: from the gbp_tag received from RADIUS * `gbp_resource`: can only be used in `dst_tags` * `mac` * `network` * `port_usage` * `radius_group` * `resource`: can only be used in `dst_tags` * `static_gbp`: applying gbp tag against matching conditions * `subnet`'

protocol.description: `tcp` / `udp` / `icmp` / `icmp6` / `gre` / `any` / `:protocol_number`, `protocol_number` is between 1-254, default is `any` `protocol_number` is between 1-254

enableArpSpoofCheck.description: Enable for dynamic ARP inspection check

enableIpSourceGuard.description: Enable for check for forging source IP address

networks.description: If `all_networks`==`false`, list of network with DHCP snooping enabled

gateway.description: Only required for EVPN-VXLAN networks, IPv4 Virtual Gateway

gateway6.description: Only required for EVPN-VXLAN networks, IPv6 Virtual Gateway

isolation.description: whether to stop clients to talk to each other, default is false (when enabled, a unique isolation_vlan_id is required). NOTE: this features requires uplink device to also a be Juniper device and `inter_switch_link` to be set. See also `inter_isolation_network_link` and `community_vlan_id` in port_usage

subnet.description: Optional for pure switching, required when L3 / routing features are used

subnet6.description: Optional for pure switching, required when L3 / routing features are used

type.description: OSPF type. enum: `default`, `nssa`, `stub`

authKeys.description: Required if `auth_type`==`md5`. Property key is the key number

authPassword.description: Required if `auth_type`==`password`, the password, max length is 8

authType.description: auth type. enum: `md5`, `none`, `password`

interfaceType.description: interface type (nbma = non-broadcast multi-access). enum: `broadcast`, `nbma`, `p2mp`, `p2p`

noReadvertiseToOverlay.description: By default, we'll re-advertise all learned OSPF routes toward overlay

inputNetworksIngresses.description: At least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified

inputPortIdsEgresses.description: At least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified

inputPortIdsIngresses.description: At least one of the `input_port_ids_ingress`, `input_port_ids_egress` or `input_networks_ingress ` should be specified

outputIpAddress.description: Exactly one of the `output_ip_address`, `output_port_id` or `output_network` should be provided

outputNetwork.description: Exactly one of the `output_ip_address`, `output_port_id` or `output_network` should be provided

outputPortId.description: Exactly one of the `output_ip_address`, `output_port_id` or `output_network` should be provided

allNetworks.description: Only if `mode`==`trunk` whether to trunk all network/vlans

allowDhcpd.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`. If DHCP snooping is enabled, whether DHCP server is allowed on the interfaces with. All the interfaces from port configs using this port usage are effected. Please notice that allow_dhcpd is a tri_state. When it is not defined, it means using the system's default setting which depends on whether the port is an access or trunk port.

allowMultipleSupplicants.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

bypassAuthWhenServerDown.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` bypass auth for known clients if set to true when RADIUS server is down

bypassAuthWhenServerDownForUnknownClient.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`=`dot1x` bypass auth for all (including unknown clients) if set to true when RADIUS server is down

communityVlanId.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`. To be used together with `isolation` under networks. Signaling that this port connects to the networks isolated but wired clients belong to the same community can talk to each other

description.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

disableAutoneg.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` if speed and duplex are specified, whether to disable autonegotiation

disabled.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` whether the port is disabled

duplex.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`, link connection mode. enum: `auto`, `full`, `half`

dynamicVlanNetworks.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x`, if dynamic vlan is used, specify the possible networks/vlans RADIUS can return

enableMacAuth.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` whether to enable MAC Auth

enableQos.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

guestNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` which network to put the device into if the device cannot do dot1x. default is null (i.e. not allowed)

interIsolationNetworkLink.description: `inter_switch_link` is used together with `isolation` under networks. NOTE: `inter_switch_link` works only between Juniper device. This has to be applied to both ports connected together

interSwitchLink.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` inter_switch_link is used together with "isolation" under networks. NOTE: inter_switch_link works only between Juniper device. This has to be applied to both ports connected together

macAuthOnly.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `enable_mac_auth`==`true`

macAuthPreferred.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` + `enable_mac_auth`==`true` + `mac_auth_only`==`false`, dot1x will be given priority then mac_auth. Enable this to prefer mac_auth over dot1x.

macAuthProtocol.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `enable_mac_auth` ==`true`. This type is ignored if mist_nac is enabled. enum: `eap-md5`, `eap-peap`, `pap`

macLimit.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` max number of mac addresses, default is 0 for unlimited, otherwise range is 1 to 16383 (upper bound constrained by platform)

mode.description: `mode`==`dynamic` must only be used if the port usage name is `dynamic`. enum: `access`, `dynamic`, `inet`, `trunk`

mtu.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` media maximum transmission unit (MTU) is the largest data unit that can be forwarded without fragmentation. Value between 256 and 9216, default value is 1514.

networks.description: Only if `mode`==`trunk`, the list of network/vlans

persistMac.description: Only if `mode`==`access` and `port_auth`!=`dot1x` whether the port should retain dynamically learned MAC addresses

poeDisabled.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` whether PoE capabilities are disabled for a port

portAuth.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` if dot1x is desired, set to dot1x. enum: `dot1x`

portNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` native network/vlan for untagged traffic

reauthInterval.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`=`dot1x` reauthentication interval range between 10 and 65535 (default: 3600)

resetDefaultWhen.description: Only if `mode`==`dynamic` Control when the DPC port should be changed to the default port usage. enum: `link_down`, `none` (let the DPC port keep at the current port usage)

rules.description: Only if `mode`==`dynamic`

serverFailNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` sets server fail fallback vlan

serverRejectNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` and `port_auth`==`dot1x` when radius server reject / fails

speed.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`, Port speed, default is auto to automatically negotiate speed enum: `100m`, `10m`, `1g`, `2.5g`, `5g`, `10g`, `25g`, `40g`, `100g`,`auto`

stormControl.description: Switch storm control. Only if `mode`!=`dynamic`

stpEdge.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` when enabled, the port is not expected to receive BPDU frames

uiEvpntopoId.description: Optional for Campus Fabric Core-Distribution ESI-LAG profile. Helper used by the UI to select this port profile as the ESI-Lag between Distribution and Access switches

useVstp.description: If this is connected to a vstp network

voipNetwork.description: Only if `mode`!=`dynamic` network/vlan for voip traffic, must also set port_network. to authenticate device, set port_auth

equalsAnies.description: Use `equals_any` to match any item in a list

rules.description: list of rules to define custom switch configuration based on different criteria. Each list must have at least one of `match_model`, `match_name` or `match_role` must be defined

additionalConfigCmds.description: additional CLI commands to append to the generated Junos config. **Note**: no check is done

matchModel.description: string the switch model must start with to use this rule. It is possible to combine with the `match_name` and `match_role` attributes

matchName.description: string the switch name must start with to use this rule. Use the `match_name_offset` to indicate the first character of the switch name to compare to. It is possible to combine with the `match_model` and `match_role` attributes

matchNameOffset.description: first character of the switch name to compare to the `match_name` value

matchRole.description: string the switch role must start with to use this rule. It is possible to combine with the `match_name` and `match_model` attributes

portConfig.description: Property key is the port name or range (e.g. "ge-0/0/0-10")

portMirroring.description: Property key is the port mirroring instance name. `port_mirroring` can be added under device/site settings. It takes interface and ports as input for ingress, interface as input for egress and can take interface and port as output. A maximum 4 mirroring ports is allowed

defaultIdpId.description: use this IDP when no explicit realm present in the incoming username/CN OR when no IDP is explicitly mapped to the incoming realm.

disableRsaeAlgorithms.description: to disable RSAE_PSS_SHA256, RSAE_PSS_SHA384, RSAE_PSS_SHA512 from server side. see https://www.openssl.org/docs/man3.0/man1/openssl-ciphers.html

euOnly.description: By default, NAC POD failover considers all NAC pods available around the globe, i.e. EU, US, or APAC based, failover happens based on geo IP of the originating site. For strict GDPR compliance NAC POD failover would only happen between the PODs located within the EU environment, and no authentication would take place outside of EU. This is an org setting that is applicable to WLANs, switch templates, mxedge clusters that have mist_nac enabled

idpMachineCertLookupField.description: allow customer to choose the EAP-TLS client certificate's field to use for IDP Machine Groups lookup. enum: `automatic`, `cn`, `dns`

idpUserCertLookupField.description: allow customer to choose the EAP-TLS client certificate's field. To use for IDP User Groups lookup. enum: `automatic`, `cn`, `email`, `upn`

serverCert.description: radius server cert to be presented in EAP TLS

useIpVersion.description: by default, NAS devices(switches/aps) and proxies(mxedge) are configured to reach mist-nac via IPv4. enum: `v4`, `v6`

useSslPort.description: By default, NAS devices (switches/aps) and proxies(mxedge) are configured to use port TCP2083(RadSec) to reach mist-nac. Set `use_ssl_port`==`true` to override that port with TCP43 (ssl), This is an org level setting that is applicable to wlans, switch_templates, and mxedge_clusters that have mist-nac enabled

excludeRealms.description: When the IDP of mxedge_proxy type, exclude the following realms from proxying in addition to other valid home realms in this org

id.description: ID of the `mist_nacidp`

userRealms.description:

  * Username-AVP (`mist.com` from john@mist.com)
  * Cert CN

maxPktLen.description: Max_len of non-management packets to capture

disableLocalSsh.description: Whether to disable local SSH (by default, local SSH is enabled with allow_mist in Org is enabled

fipsZeroizePassword.description: password required to zeroize devices (FIPS) on site level

limitSshAccess.description: Whether to allow certain SSH keys to SSH into the AP (see Site:Setting)

conductorToken.description: Token to be used by the SSR Devices to connect to the Conductor

disableStats.description: Disable stats collection on SSR devices

customVersions.description: Custom version to be used. The Property Key is the switch hardware and the property value is the firmware version

enabled.description: Enable auto upgrade for the switch

snapshot.description: Enable snapshot during the upgrade process

apAffinityThreshold.description: If the field is set in both site/setting and org/setting, the value from site/setting will be used.

aggressiveness.description: enum: `auto`, `high`, `low`

customProbes.description: Custom probes to be used for synthetic tests

lanNetworks.description: List of networks to be used for synthetic tests

aggressiveness.description: enum: `auto`, `high`, `low`

host.description: If `type`==`icmp` or `type`==`tcp`, Host to be used for the custom probe

port.description: If `type`==`tcp`, Port to be used for the custom probe

type.description: enum: `curl`, `icmp`, `tcp`

url.description: If `type`==`curl`, URL to be used for the custom probe, can be url or IP

networks.description: List of networks to be used for synthetic tests

probes.description: app name comes from `custom_probes` above or /const/synthetic_test_probes

disabled.description: For some vlans where we don't want this to run

probes.description: app name comes from `custom_probes` above or /const/synthetic_test_probes

timeOfDay.description: `any` / HH:MM (24-hour format)

stSubnet.description: requiring /12 or bigger to support 16 private IPs for 65535 gateways

role.description: access permissions. enum: `admin`, `helpdesk`, `installer`, `read`, `write`

scope.description: enum: `org`, `site`, `sitegroup`

siteId.description: Required if `scope`==`site`

sitegroupId.description: Required if `scope`==`sitegroup`

views.description: Custom roles restrict Org users to specific UI views. This is useful for limiting UI access of Org users. Custom roles restrict Org users to specific UI views. This is useful for limiting UI access of Org users. You can define custom roles by adding the `views` attribute along with `role` when assigning privileges. Below are the list of supported UI views. Note that this is UI only feature. | UI View | Required Role | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | `reporting` | `read` | full access to all analytics tools | | `marketing` | `read` | can view analytics and location maps | | `super_observer` | `read` | can view all the organization except the subscription page | | `location` | `write` | can view and manage location maps, can view analytics | | `security` | `write` | can view and manage site labels, policies and security | | `switch_admin` | `helpdesk` | can view and manage Switch ports, can view wired clients | | `mxedge_admin` | `admin` | can view and manage Mist edges and Mist tunnels | | `lobby_admin` | `admin` | full access to Org and Site Pre-shared keys |

strategy.description: enum: `disabled`, `simple`, `manual`

bfdProfile.description: enum: `broadband`, `lte`

bfdUseTunnelMode.description: If `type`==`mesh` and for SSR only, whether to use tunnel mode

ip.description: If different from the wan port

peerPaths.description: If `type`==`mesh`, Property key is the Peer Interface name

classPercentages.description: percentages for different class of traffic: high / medium / low / best-effort adding up to 100

keywrapFormat.description: enum: `ascii`, `hex`

apps.description:
Map from app key to bandwidth in kbps. 
Property key is the app key, defined in Get Application List

wxtagIds.description: Map from wxtag_id of Hostname Wxlan Tags to bandwidth in kbps. Property key is the `wxtag_id`

dstSubnet.description: Subnet filter is not required but helps AP to only inspect certain traffic (thus reducing AP load)

srcSubnet.description: Subnet filter is not required but helps AP to only inspect certain traffic (thus reducing AP load)

eapReauth.description: Whether to trigger EAP reauth when the session ends

enableMacAuth.description: Whether to enable MAC Auth, uses the same auth_servers

keyIdx.description: When `type`==`wep`

keys.description: When type=wep, four 10-character or 26-character hex string, null can be used. All keys, if provided, have to be in the same length

multiPskOnly.description: When `type`==`psk`, whether to only use multi_psk

owe.description: if `type`==`open`. enum: `disabled`, `enabled` (means transition mode), `required`

pairwises.description: When `type`=`psk` or `type`=`eap`, one or more of `wpa1-ccmp`, `wpa1-tkip`, `wpa2-ccmp`, `wpa2-tkip`, `wpa3`

privateWlan.description: When `multi_psk_only`==`true`, whether private wlan is enabled

psk.description: When `type`==`psk`, 8-64 characters, or 64 hex characters

type.description: enum: `eap`, `eap192`, `open`, `psk`, `psk-tkip`, `psk-wpa2-tkip`, `wep`

keywrapFormat.description: enum: `ascii`, `hex`

requireMessageAuthenticator.description: Whether to require Message-Authenticator in requests

additionalVlanIds.description: additional VLAN IDs (on the LAN side or from other WLANs) should we be forwarding bonjour queries/responses

enabled.description: Whether to enable bonjour for this WLAN. Once enabled, limit_bcast is assumed true, allow_mdns is assumed false

services.description:
What services are allowed. 
Property key is the service name

disableLocal.description: Whether to prevent wireless clients to discover bonjour devices on the same WLAN

radiusGroups.description: Optional, if the service is further restricted for certain RADIUS groups

scope.description: how bonjour services should be discovered for the same WLAN. enum: `same_ap`, `same_map`, `same_site`

allowedHostnames.description: List of hostnames without http(s):// (matched by substring)

radiusGroups.description: Map between radius_group and the desired DNS server (IPv4 only). Property key is the RADIUS group, property value is the desired DNS Server

defaultPsk.description: Default PSK to use if cloud WLC is not available, 8-63 characters

forceLookup.description: When 11r is enabled, we'll try to use the cached PMK, this can be disabled. `false` means auto

source.description: enum: `cloud_psks`, `radius`

defaultVlanIds.description: Default VLAN ID(s) can be a number, a range of VLAN IDs, a variable or multiple numbers, ranges or variables as a VLAN pool. Default VLAN as a pool of VLANS requires 0.14.x or newer firmware

enabled.description: Requires `vlan_enabled`==`true` to be set to `true`. Whether to enable dynamic vlan

type.description: standard (using Tunnel-Private-Group-ID, widely supported), airespace-interface-name (Airespace/Cisco). enum: `airespace-interface-name`, `standard`

vlans.description: Map between vlan_id (as string) to airespace interface names (comma-separated) or null for standard mapping * if `dynamic_vlan.type`==`standard`, property key is the Vlan ID and property value is \"\" * if `dynamic_vlan.type`==`airespace-interface-name`, property key is the Vlan ID and property value is the Airespace Interface Name

enabled.description: Whether to enable hotspot 2.0 config

venueName.description: Venue name, default is site name

enabled.description: Whether to inject option 82 when forwarding DHCP packets

acctInterimInterval.description: How frequently should interim accounting be reported, 60-65535. default is 0 (use one specified in Access-Accept request from Server). Very frequent messages can affect the performance of the radius server, 600 and up is recommended when enabled.

authServersRetries.description: Radius auth session retries. Following fast timers are set if `fast_dot1x_timers` knob is enabled. "retries" are set to value of `auth_servers_timeout`. "max-requests" is also set when setting `auth_servers_retries` is set to default value to 3.

authServersTimeout.description: Radius auth session timeout. Following fast timers are set if `fast_dot1x_timers` knob is enabled. "quite-period" and "transmit-period" are set to half the value of `auth_servers_timeout`. "supplicant-timeout" is also set when setting `auth_servers_timeout` is set to default value of 10.

coaEnabled.description: Allows a RADIUS server to dynamically modify the authorization status of a user session.

coaPort.description: the communication port used for Change of Authorization (CoA) messages

enabled.description: When enabled: * `auth_servers` is ignored * `acct_servers` is ignored * `auth_servers_*` are ignored * `coa_servers` is ignored * `radsec` is ignored * `coa_enabled` is assumed

fastDot1xTimers.description: If set to true, sets default fast-timers with values calculated from `auth_servers_timeout` and `auth_server_retries`.

network.description: Which network the mist nac server resides in

sourceIp.description: In case there is a static IP for this network, we can specify it using source ip

allowWlanIdRoam.description: Optional if `amazon_enabled`==`true`. Whether to allow guest to connect to other Guest WLANs (with different `WLAN.ssid`) of same org without reauthentication (disable random_mac for seamless roaming)

amazonClientId.description: Optional if `amazon_enabled`==`true`. Amazon OAuth2 client id. This is optional. If not provided, it will use a default one.

amazonClientSecret.description: Optional if `amazon_enabled`==`true`. Amazon OAuth2 client secret. If amazon_client_id was provided, provide a corresponding value. Else leave blank.

amazonEmailDomains.description: Optional if `amazon_enabled`==`true`. Matches authenticated user email against provided domains. If null or [], all authenticated emails will be allowed.

amazonEnabled.description: Whether amazon is enabled as a login method

amazonExpire.description: Optional if `amazon_enabled`==`true`. Interval for which guest remains authorized using amazon auth (in minutes), if not provided, uses expire`

auth.description: authentication scheme. enum: `amazon`, `azure`, `email`, `external`, `facebook`, `google`, `microsoft`, `multi`, `none`, `password`, `sms`, `sponsor`, `sso`

azureClientId.description: Required if `azure_enabled`==`true`. Azure active directory app client id

azureClientSecret.description: Required if `azure_enabled`==`true`. Azure active directory app client secret

azureEnabled.description: Whether Azure Active Directory is enabled as a login method

azureExpire.description: Interval for which guest remains authorized using azure auth (in minutes), if not provided, uses expire`

azureTenantId.description: Required if `azure_enabled`==`true`. Azure active directory tenant id.

broadnetPassword.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`broadnet`

broadnetSid.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`broadnet`

broadnetUserId.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`broadnet`

bypassWhenCloudDown.description: Whether to bypass the guest portal when cloud not reachable (and apply the default policies)

clickatellApiKey.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`clickatell`

crossSite.description: Whether to allow guest to roam between WLANs (with same `WLAN.ssid`, regardless of variables) of different sites of same org without reauthentication (disable random_mac for seamless roaming)

emailEnabled.description: Whether email (access code verification) is enabled as a login method

enabled.description: Whether guest portal is enabled

expire.description: How long to remain authorized, in minutes

externalPortalUrl.description: Required if `wlan_portal_auth`==`external`. External portal URL (e.g. https://host/url) where we can append our query parameters to

facebookClientId.description: Required if `facebook_enabled`==`true`. Facebook OAuth2 app id. This is optional. If not provided, it will use a default one.

facebookClientSecret.description: Required if `facebook_enabled`==`true`. Facebook OAuth2 app secret. If facebook_client_id was provided, provide a corresponding value. Else leave blank.

facebookEmailDomains.description: Optional if `facebook_enabled`==`true`. Matches authenticated user email against provided domains. If null or [], all authenticated emails will be allowed.

facebookEnabled.description: Whether facebook is enabled as a login method

facebookExpire.description: Optional if `facebook_enabled`==`true`. Interval for which guest remains authorized using facebook auth (in minutes), if not provided, uses expire`

forward.description: Whether to forward the user to another URL after authorized

forwardUrl.description: URL to forward the user to

googleClientId.description: Google OAuth2 app id. This is optional. If not provided, it will use a default one.

googleClientSecret.description: Optional if `google_enabled`==`true`. Google OAuth2 app secret. If google_client_id was provided, provide a corresponding value. Else leave blank.

googleEmailDomains.description: Optional if `google_enabled`==`true`. Matches authenticated user email against provided domains. If null or [], all authenticated emails will be allowed.

googleEnabled.description: Whether Google is enabled as login method

googleExpire.description: Optional if `google_enabled`==`true`. Interval for which guest remains authorized using Google Auth (in minutes), if not provided, uses expire`

gupshupPassword.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`gupshup`

gupshupUserid.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`gupshup`

microsoftClientId.description: Optional if `microsoft_enabled`==`true`. Microsoft 365 OAuth2 client id. This is optional. If not provided, it will use a default one.

microsoftClientSecret.description: Optional if `microsoft_enabled`==`true`. Microsoft 365 OAuth2 client secret. If microsoft_client_id was provided, provide a corresponding value. Else leave blank.

microsoftEmailDomains.description: Optional if `microsoft_enabled`==`true`. Matches authenticated user email against provided domains. If null or [], all authenticated emails will be allowed.

microsoftEnabled.description: Whether microsoft 365 is enabled as a login method

microsoftExpire.description: Optional if `microsoft_enabled`==`true`. Interval for which guest remains authorized using microsoft auth (in minutes), if not provided, uses expire`

passphraseExpire.description: Optional if `passphrase_enabled`==`true`. Interval for which guest remains authorized using passphrase auth (in minutes), if not provided, uses `expire`

password.description: Required if `passphrase_enabled`==`true`.

predefinedSponsorsEnabled.description: Whether to show list of sponsor emails mentioned in `sponsors` object as a dropdown. If both `sponsor_notify_all` and `predefined_sponsors_enabled` are false, behavior is acc to `sponsor_email_domains`

predefinedSponsorsHideEmail.description: Whether to hide sponsors email from list of sponsors

puzzelPassword.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`puzzel`

puzzelServiceId.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`puzzel`

puzzelUsername.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`puzzel`

smsEnabled.description: Whether sms is enabled as a login method

smsExpire.description: Optional if `sms_enabled`==`true`. Interval for which guest remains authorized using sms auth (in minutes), if not provided, uses expire`

smsMessageFormat.description: Optional if `sms_enabled`==`true`. SMS Message format

smsProvider.description: Optional if `sms_enabled`==`true`. enum: `broadnet`, `clickatell`, `gupshup`, `manual`, `puzzel`, `smsglobal`, `telstra`, `twilio`

smsglobalApiKey.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`smsglobal`, Client API Key

smsglobalApiSecret.description: Required if `sms_provider`==`smsglobal`, Client secret

sponsorAutoApprove.description: Optional if `sponsor_enabled`==`true`. Whether to automatically approve guest and allow sponsor to revoke guest access, needs predefined_sponsors_enabled enabled and sponsor_notify_all disabled

sponsorEmailDomains.description: List of domain allowed for sponsor email. Required if `sponsor_enabled` is `true` and `sponsors` is empty.

sponsorExpire.description: Optional if `sponsor_enabled`==`true`. Interval for which guest remains authorized using sponsor auth (in minutes), if not provided, uses expire`

sponsorLinkValidityDuration.description: Optional if `sponsor_enabled`==`true`. How long to remain valid sponsored guest request approve/deny link received in email, in minutes. Default is 60 minutes.

sponsorNotifyAll.description: Optional if `sponsor_enabled`==`true`. whether to notify all sponsors that are mentioned in `sponsors` object. Both `sponsor_notify_all` and `predefined_sponsors_enabled` should be true in order to notify sponsors. If true, email sent to 10 sponsors in no particular order.

sponsorStatusNotify.description: Optional if `sponsor_enabled`==`true`. If enabled, guest will get email about sponsor's action (approve/deny)

sponsors.description: object of allowed sponsors email with name. Required if `sponsor_enabled` is `true` and `sponsor_email_domains` is empty. Property key is the sponsor email, Property value is the sponsor name

ssoDefaultRole.description: Optional if `wlan_portal_auth`==`sso`, default role to assign if theres no match. By default, an assertion is treated as invalid when theres no role matched

ssoForcedRole.description: Optional if `wlan_portal_auth`==`sso`

ssoIdpCert.description: Required if `wlan_portal_auth`==`sso`. IDP Cert (used to verify the signed response)

ssoIdpSignAlgo.description: Optional if `wlan_portal_auth`==`sso`, Signing algorithm for SAML Assertion. enum: `sha1`, `sha256`, `sha384`, `sha512`

ssoIdpSsoUrl.description: Required if `wlan_portal_auth`==`sso`, IDP Single-Sign-On URL

ssoIssuer.description: Required if `wlan_portal_auth`==`sso`, IDP issuer URL

ssoNameidFormat.description: Optional if `wlan_portal_auth`==`sso`. enum: `email`, `unspecified`
